Selecting View Manager Options

Before running View Manager, you should select appropriate options for the merge you plan to perform. Although View Manager has many run options, many of them do not apply to all types of run operations. However, all run operations share some options. For example, the General and Locking tabs apply to all operations.

To select View Manager options:

  1. Start View Manager.

  2. Select Tools > Options. The Options dialog displays. At the top of the dialog, a drop-down list box appears, from which you can select:

    • Source to Target

    • Bidirectional

    • Missing Objects Only

    • Copy to Target

    Each of these items represents a specific type of run operation. When you select an item from this list, the tabs and options available for that type of run operation are enabled on the Options tabs.

  3. Select a specific type of run operation.

  4. On the General tab, select the options you wish to use with this type of operation.

  5. Move to the remaining tabs, and specify additional options.

  6. When you are done, click OK.

Note: You can select options for one or more types of run operations and save them to a properties file for later reuse.

View Manager Options

For details on any of the following options, see the StarTeam Administrator's Guide.

General Tab

Include child views

Indicates how much of the tree to include in the run operation. It is valid only when a view is selected as the source object and that view's configuration is current. When synchronizing views, it applies to both the selected source and target views. Default is cleared.

Include child folders

Indicates how much of the tree to include in the run operation. It is valid only when a folder is selected as the source object. When synchronizing folders, it applies to both the selected source and target folders. Default is selected.

(Replicate) Users

Allows View Manager to use the original user names in the Created By properties of created objects. Default is cleared.

(Replicate) Creation times

Copies creation times along with created items. When cleared, object creation times are the times at which View Manager creates them. If the source and target objects are the same view or folders are in the same view, objects will be shared rather than added. Thus, those objects have the original creation times, regardless of this option setting. Default is cleared.

(Replicate) View labels

Copies all view label definitions from one view to the other. Depending on your missing-object option settings and the type of operation, view label definitions can be copied from the source to the target and the target to the source.

(Replicate) Promotion states

Copies all the promotion state definitions from one view to the other. Depending on your missing-object option settings and the type of operation, promotion state definitions can be copied from the source to the target and the target to the source. Default is cleared.

(Replicate) Revision labels

Copies the revision labels on an as-needed basis, as file revisions are created. Default is cleared.

Number of retries

Specifies the number of times View Manager will attempt to connect to a given server. Default is 3 times.

Time between retries ___ minutes

Specifies the number of minutes between reconnection attempts. Default is one minute but it may take a few minutes for the disconnect to be detected.

Missing Objects Tab

These options do not apply to copy-to-target operations because, in a copy-to-target operation, everything is missing from the target.

Add projects to the target

This option is always disabled.

Add views to the target

Allows views that exist only in the source object to be shared to the target object; such views are copied in entirety to the target project. This option includes the view, its child views, their folders and files, recursively. Default is selected.

Add folders to the target

Allows that exist only in the source object to be shared to the target object; such folders are shared in entirety to the target object. This option includes the folder, its child folders and files, recursively. Default is selected.

Add files to the target

Allows files that exist only in the source object to be shared to the target object. No file is shared based on this option unless its folder (or an equivalent folder) exists in both the source and target objects. Default is selected.

Delete folders from the source

Allows folders that exist only in the source object to be deleted from the source object; such folders are deleted in entirety from the source object. This option includes the folder, its child folders and files, recursively. Default is cleared.

Delete files from the source

Allows files that exist only in the source object to be deleted from the source object. No file is deleted based on this option unless its folder (or an equivalent folder) exists in both the source and the target. Default is cleared.

Add projects to the source

This option is always disabled.

Add views to the source

Allows views that exist only in the target object to be added to the source object; such views are copied in entirety to the source project. This option includes the view, its child views, their folders and files, recursively. Default is cleared.

Add folders to the source

Allows folders that exist only in the target object to be shared to the source object; such folders are shared in entirety to the source object. This option includes the folder, its child folders and files, recursively. Default is cleared.

Add files to the source

Allows files that exist only in the target object to be shared to the source object. No file is shared based on this option unless its folder (or an equivalent folder) exists in both the source and target objects. Default is cleared.

Delete folders from the target

Allows folders that exist only in the target object to be deleted from the target object; such folders are deleted in entirety from the target object. This option includes the folder, its child folders and files, recursively. Default is cleared.

Delete files from the target

Allows files that exist only in the target object to be deleted from the target object. No file is added based on this option unless its folder (or an equivalent folder) exists in both the source and target objects. Default is cleared.

Merge Tab

Record each merge

Records the revisions involved in a given merge. Recording and tracking merges goes hand-in-hand. Default is cleared.

Use merge tracking for merge resolution

Uses the most recent recorded merge as a basis for the status of a given file during a preview or for the actual merge operation. Without merge tracking, corresponding files are merged as long as they are not identical. With merge tracking, the files can be very different and still not require a merge operation. Default is cleared.

Use source as common ancestor

Bases the merge on the source file from the last recorded merge, as well as the pair of files being merged. Without merge tracking, the most recent common ancestor is used to perform the three-way merge. The common ancestor is a historical revision with the same revision number in both views. Default is selected.

Use target as common ancestor

Bases the merge on the target file from the last recorded merge as well as the pair of files being merged. Without merge tracking, the most recent common ancestor is used to perform the three-way merge. The common ancestor is a historical revision with the same revision number in both views. Default is cleared.

Merge Utility Tab

The options on this tab are valid only if the run operation is source-to-target or bidirectional. Default utilities are Visual Merge and Visual Diff. If you prefer to use other merge and comparison utilities, you can select alternates and designate options to be used with them.

Visual Merge

Designates Visual Merge as your merge utility on Windows platforms. Default is selected.

Ignore whitespace

When comparing two lines of text files, ignores trailing white space and treats all other strings of white space as equal in length. Default is cleared.

Alternate merge utility

Allows you to specify a merge utility other than Visual Merge. Default is cleared.

Merge utility

Allows you to enter the path to the alternate merge utility. Default is blank.

Options

Lists the command-line options that go with the alternate merge utility. Use the following terms to represent files sent by the View Manager to the merge utility:

$branchtip, used as a place holder for the path to the tip revision of the file to be merged.

$usertip, used as a place holder for the path to the local working file to be merged.

$basefile, used as a place holder for the path to the common ancestor for the $branchtip and $usertip files.

$resultfile, used as a place holder for the path to the file that will store the output from the merged file.

This option is enabled only if the Alternate merge utility option has been selected. Default is blank.

Alternate comparison utility

Allows you to specify a merge utility other than Visual Diff. Default is cleared.

Comparison utility

Allows you to enter the path to the alternate comparison utility. Default is blank.

Options

Lists the command-line options that go with the alternate comparison utility. Use the following terms to represent files sent by the View Manager to the merge utility:

$file1, used as a place holder for the path to the first of the two files to be compared.

$file2, used as a place holder for the path to the second of the two files to be compared.

This option is enabled only if the Alternate comparison utility check box has been selected. Default is blank.

Locking Tab

Exclusively lock server on run

Exclusively locks the server when a run operation begins. Default is cleared.

Unlock server after run

Unlocks the server when a run operation ends. The operation ends when the last two files have been examined and reported upon. Default is cleared.

Exclusively lock server on preview

Exclusively locks the server when a preview operation begins. This option is always enabled. Default is cleared.

Unlock server after preview

Unlocks the server when a preview operation ends. The operation ends when the last two files have been examined and reported upon. Default is cleared.

File Tab

Copy file history

Copies the file history and the appropriate vault files to the source and/or the target depending on the direction of the operation. This option does not apply to files that have changed in both the source and target. Default is cleared.

Break lock if file needs to be checked in

When selected, allows View Manager to check in files even if they are locked by someone else. You must have the access rights necessary to break locks. Default is cleared.

Resolve differences for text files

Files can be resolved automatically by using the merge utility or by substituting the existing source or target file for the merged file.

Merge automatically

When selected, View Manager merges any text file that has no conflicts. When cleared, View Manager does no automatic merging of text files. Default is cleared.

Use specified merge utility

Allows you to resolve conflicts using the merge utility. Default is selected.

Use existing file as merged file

Allows you to use either the source or target file as the merged file. Default is cleared.

Use source file

Uses the source file as the merged file. Enabled when Use existing file as merged file option is enabled. Default is selected.

Use target file

Uses the target file as the merged file. Enabled when Use existing file as merged file option is enabled. Default is cleared.

Resolve differences for binary files

Binary files cannot be merged by View Manager; however, binary files with differences can be ignored or resolved by substituting the existing source or target file for the merged file.

Use existing file as merged file

When selected, allows user to use either the source or target file as the merged file. When cleared, binary file pairs are not merged. The files have the status Merge, while the Action column says Manual merge. Default is selected.

Always enabled. Default is selected.

Use source file

Uses the source file as the merged file. Default is selected.

Use target file

Uses the target file as the merged file. Default is cleared.

Lock unresolved files

Allows you to lock the files that have not been resolved. Files are unresolved if they have Merge status but cannot be resolved automatically because they are text files that have conflicts, they are text files that have differences and merging is not done automatically, or they are binary files that were not resolved by selecting either the source or the target file as the merged file.

Text

Controls the locking of unresolved text files. Default is cleared.

Binary

Controls the locking of unresolved binary files. Default is cleared.
